Key Match Events: Ireland openers Paul Stirling and Andrew Balbirnie made a steady start in reply but their departures for nine and 17, respectively, were soon followed by the dismissal of Harry Tector for seven.
A 62-run stand for the seventh-wicket between George Dockrell (30*) and Mark Adair (34) helped Ireland get back into contention.
Jeremy Gordon held his nerve with the ball to restrict Ireland's late charge.
Pre-Game Insights: Ireland captain Paul Stirling would have been delighted to call right at the toss this time around.
Post-Match Reflections: Ireland now need to win both of their final two matches in Group A to stand any chance of progressing to the knockout stages.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Canada picked up their first ever World Cup win.
Ireland now head to Florida, where they play their final two fixtures in Group A against co-hosts USA on Friday, 14 June and Pakistan two days later.
Others: Canada closed on 137-7 from their 20 overs.
Ireland slumped to 59-6 before George Dockrell and Mark Adair battled their side back into contention.
